description: Once upon a time, there was a kingdom of fairy tales called "Märchenland", where many fairy tale characters live together in joy. Suddenly, the evil emperor Pierrot made an invasion on Märchenland, sealing its Queen in the process. To revive the Queen, the symbol of happiness called Cure Decor, "the Queen's scattered power of light of happiness", is required. To collect the Cure Decor, a fairy named Candy searches for the Pretty Cures on Earth. There, Candy meets a girl, who decides to collect the Cure Decor. Now, will the world earn a "happy ending"?

name.native: ブライアン・テイラー

node.description:
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/東堂いづみ) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Izumi_Todo)

Izumi Toudou is a collective pseudonym for [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/)'s staff.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/nassy_takanashi) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/nassy_takanashi/) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/64mecceQewFCKwCK6JBW0o)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/298477416)

Oobari began his career when he joined the animation studio Ashi Production, working on titles like [Tokusou Kihei Dorvack](https://anilist.co/anime/5143/) and [Sei Juushi Bismarck](https://anilist.co/anime/2361/). Soon after, at the age of 19, he got his first major break when he landed the role of mecha designer on [Dancouga: Super Beast Machine God](https://anilist.co/anime/2255/). Not too long after, at the young age of 21, he was given his first directorial role by directing episodes 5 and 6 of the [Bubblegum Crisis](https://anilist.co/anime/1347/) OVA series. 

Oobari mainly likes to work within the sci-fi mecha and fighting genres. His designs are easily recognizable from the voluptuous female forms and well-toned pretty boys he tends to create to appeal to wide audiences. For references, he likes to use images of professional wrestlers and models. He is friends with fellow former animator and current freelance illustrator [Tsukasa Kotoboki](https://anilist.co/staff/97965/).

He wasn't originally interested in animation but was inspired by [Satoshi Urushihara](https://anilist.co/staff/98177/).

[Agency Profile](http://amuleto.jp/talents/yoshidahitomi.html) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/happy-mipyoko-life/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/hiTomi_713)

__Height:__ 155 cm

Member of the duet [Blue Drops](https://anilist.co/staff/106305/Blue-Drops) with [Saori Hayami](https://anilist.co/staff/95869/Saori-Hayami).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/大田和寛)

Freelancer with former ties with [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/) and [Shaft](https://anilist.co/studio/44/).
She has sung the theme song for the anime Heartcatch Precure! and is also a member of the female pop group C-ZONE.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/145049847)

[Website](http://www.starball.jp/takatori/)
[Blog](http://blog.goo.ne.jp/takatorihideaki/)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/akichu5jp)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/suzumevachi)

Freelancer formerly affiliated with [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/).

Close friends with [Rie Matsumoto](https://anilist.co/staff/107664/), and the two often work together.
He passed away from undisclosed causes in January 2020.
He passed away from undisclosed causes in January 2020.

Affiliated with [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/) since the early '80s.

A director and animation director. She is most known by her works under Toei Animation.
